alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Montgomery; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:10PM CDT until March 25 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Carroll County in north central Mississippi... Montgomery County in north central Mississippi... Webster County in north central Mississippi... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1010 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Winona, Eupora, Duck Hill, North Carrollton, Lodi, Sweatman, Embry, Bellefontaine, Clarkson, Cumberland, Mantee, Carrollton and Walthall. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
